Detailed Description

template<typename T>
class ting::Matrix4< T >

4x4 matrix template class.

Note, that this matrix class stores elements in memory column by column. This is the same way as OpenGL matrices are stored in memory. This means easy use of this class with OpenGL.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<typename T>
ting::Matrix4< T >::Matrix4 (  )  [inline]

Default constructor.

NOTE: it does not initialize the matrix with any values. Matrix elements are undefined after the matrix is created with this constructor.

Returns:
pointer to array of 4 elements which forms the requested column of the matirx.
template<typename T>
T* ting::Matrix4< T >::operator[] ( unsigned  col  )  [inline]

returns pointer to specified column.

Returns pointer to array of 4 elements which forms a matrix column specified by argument. Thus, it is possible to access matrix elements using double [] operator as follows: 

 Matrix4 m;
 m[0][0] = 1;//assign 1 to element at row 0 column 0
 m[3][2] = 3;//assign 3 to element at row 2 column 3
 float elem = m[4][3];//assign value at row 3 column 4 of the matrix to variable 'elem'
Parameters:
col - column number.
Returns:
pointer to array of 4 elements which forms the requested column of the matirx.

template<typename T>
Matrix4& ting::Matrix4< T >::Translate ( T  x,
T  y 
) [inline]

Multiply this matrix by translation matrix.

Multiplies this matrix by Translation matrix from the right (M = M * T). Translation only occurs in x-y plane, no translation in z direction, i.e. z component of translation vector is assumed being 0.

Parameters:
x - x component of translation vector.
y - y component of translation vector.
Returns:
reference to this matrix object.
